com.apriori.reflect

Class ClassHierarchyScanner<R,P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.reflect.ClassHierarchyScanner<R,P>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - result type of invoking the scanner
    P - parameter type for invoking the scanner (or Void if there is no parameter)

    public class ClassHierarchyScanner<R,P>
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that scans an entire type hierarchy. It delegates to a given action for each type in the hierarchy.
    See Also:
    builder(), scanWith(Class, Object, BiFunction)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ClassHierarchyScanner.Builder<R,P>
      Builder pattern for constructing ClassHierarchyScanner instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Creates a new builder.
      R scan(java.lang.Class<?> clazz, P param)
      Scans the hierarchy of the specified type.
      static <R,P> R scanWith(java.lang.Class<?> clazz, P param, java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Class<?>,P,R> action)
      Scans the hierarchy of the specified type using the specified action.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static <R,P> ClassHierarchyScanner.Builder<R,P> builder()
        Creates a new builder. The default settings include pre-order traversal, stopping the scan on the first non-null result, and including interfaces in the scan.
        Returns:
        a new builder

      • scanWith

        public static <R,P> R scanWith(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                               P param,
                               java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Class<?>,P,R> action)
        Scans the hierarchy of the specified type using the specified action. The default settings will be used: pre-order traversal, stopping the scan on the first non-null result, and including interfaces in the scan.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the type whose hierarchy will be scanned
        param - an optional parameter
        action - the action that is invoked for each type in the hierarchy
        Returns:
        the first non-null result from the specified action

      • scan

        public R scan(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
              P param)
        Scans the hierarchy of the specified type. The parameter is passed to the underlying action for each type visited. The result will either be the first non-null result from the underlying action or the last result.
        Parameters:
        clazz - a type
        param - an optional parameter
        Returns:
        a result
        See Also:
        ClassHierarchyScanner.Builder.scanEverything(), ClassHierarchyScanner.Builder.scanUntilValueFound()
